summary: The last of the Federal Reserve's emergency lending programs supported through CARES Act funding ended in early 2021. As of September 1, 2021, the programs had about $19 billion in assets. Economic indicators we examined suggest that these programs helped improve liquidity and access to credit in markets they targeted. Entities that used the programs, such as state and local governments and small businesses, generally...
title: Federal Reserve Lending Programs: Credit Markets Served by the Programs Have Stabilized, but Vulnerabilities Remain
